SENT.plain: Venous sinus thrombosis has been regarded as a known cause of intracranial hypertension
We report a case of long-standing raised intracranial hypertension (ICT) that presented with deteriorating vision in both eyes
Magnetic resonance (MR) imaging of the brain and cerebral angiography showed blockage of superior saggital sinus and sigmoid sinuses with bilateral dural arteriovenous fistulae (DAVF) formation
